title: Question 13: Why sometimes the network rate is so poor while using HSPA as the uplink?
answer:
(1) Basing on the 2G network the bandwidth of data service is low, so the speed is so poor while the signal of 3G network isnâ€™t very well meanwhile the HSPA device registers to 2G network mode.
(2) Besides, data service of the mobile device shares the bandwidth with other services. That is to say the bandwidth bears all the services of the BTS and it is shared when many users connect to the BTS. Thus, the bandwidth belongs to everyone will decline sharply.
